procedure.title: To configure the Networking server component
procedure.para: The Networking server component configuration includes the database, authentication mechanism, message queue, topology change notifications, and plug-in.

note.para: Default configuration files vary by distribution. You might need to add these sections and options rather than modifying existing sections and options. Also, an ellipsis (...) in the configuration snippets indicates potential default configuration options that you should retain.

step.para: Edit the /etc/neutron/neutron.conf file and complete the following actions:
In the [database] section, configure database access:
Replace NEUTRON_DBPASS with the password you chose for the database.
In the [DEFAULT] and [oslo_messaging_rabbit] sections, configure RabbitMQ message queue access:
step.programlisting:
[DEFAULT] ... rpc_backend = rabbit
[oslo_messaging_rabbit] ... rabbit_host = controller rabbit_userid = openstack rabbit_password = RABBIT_PASS
step.para: Replace RABBIT_PASS with the password you chose for the openstack account in RabbitMQ.
In the [DEFAULT] and [keystone_authtoken] sections, configure Identity service access:
step.programlisting:
[DEFAULT] ... auth_strategy = keystone
[keystone_authtoken] ... auth_uri = http://controller:5000 auth_url = http://controller:35357 auth_plugin = password project_domain_id = default user_domain_id = default project_name = service username = neutron password = NEUTRON_PASS
step.para: Replace NEUTRON_PASS with the password you chose for the neutron user in the Identity service.

note.para: Comment out or remove any other options in the [keystone_authtoken] section.

step.para: In the [DEFAULT] section, enable the Modular Layer 2 (ML2) plug-in, router service, and overlapping IP addresses:
step.programlisting: [DEFAULT] ... core_plugin = ml2 service_plugins = router allow_overlapping_ips = True

step.para: In the [DEFAULT] and [nova] sections, configure Networking to notify Compute of network topology changes:
step.programlisting:
[DEFAULT] ... notify_nova_on_port_status_changes = True notify_nova_on_port_data_changes = True nova_url = http://controller:8774/v2
[nova] ... auth_url = http://controller:35357 auth_plugin = password project_domain_id = default user_domain_id = default region_name = RegionOne project_name = service username = nova password = NOVA_PASS
step.para: Replace NOVA_PASS with the password you chose for the nova user in the Identity service.
(Optional) To assist with troubleshooting, enable verbose logging in the [DEFAULT] section:

procedure.title: To configure the Modular Layer 2 (ML2) plug-in
procedure.para: The ML2 plug-in uses the Open vSwitch (OVS) mechanism (agent) to build the virtual networking framework for instances. However, the controller node does not need the OVS components because it does not handle instance network traffic.

step.para: Edit the /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini file and complete the following actions:
In the [ml2] section, enable the flat, VLAN, generic routing encapsulation (GRE), and virtual extensible LAN (VXLAN) network type drivers, GRE tenant networks, and the OVS mechanism driver:
step.programlisting: [ml2] ... type_drivers = flat,vlan,gre,vxlan tenant_network_types = gre mechanism_drivers = openvswitch

warning.para: Once you configure the ML2 plug-in, changing values in the type_drivers option can lead to database inconsistency.

procedure.title: To configure Compute to use Networking
procedure.para: By default, distribution packages configure Compute to use legacy networking. You must reconfigure Compute to manage networks through Networking.

step.para: Edit the /etc/nova/nova.conf file on the controller node and complete the following actions:
In the [DEFAULT] section, configure the APIs and drivers:
step.programlisting: [DEFAULT] ... network_api_class = nova.network.neutronv2.api.API security_group_api = neutron linuxnet_interface_driver = nova.network.linux_net.LinuxOVSInterfaceDriver firewall_driver = nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver

note.para: By default, Compute uses an internal firewall service. Since Networking includes a firewall service, you must disable the Compute firewall service by using the nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver firewall driver.

step.para: In the [neutron] section, configure access parameters:
step.programlisting: [neutron] ... url = http://controller:9696 auth_strategy = keystone admin_auth_url = http://controller:35357/v2.0 admin_tenant_name = service admin_username = neutron admin_password = NEUTRON_PASS
step.para: Replace NEUTRON_PASS with the password you chose for the neutron user in the Identity service.
